summary.para: Exposed by a host to allow clients to pass the host their interface pointers.

param.name: punk
param.para: A pointer to the client's interface. To notify the host to terminate filtering and stop calling your interface, set this parameter to NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: After you get a pointer to the host's interface, call this method to pass the host a pointer to your interface. The host will then use this pointer to call your method to request a pointer to your interface. If this call fails, IFolderFilterSite.SetFilter returns E_NOINTERFACEAVAILABLE. If the call is successful, the host will then call the IFolderFilter interface's two methods to determine how to enumerate the contents of the folder.

summary.para: Exported by a host to allow clients to specify how to filter a Shell folder enumeration.

remarks.para: The most common use of this interface is when your application calls . When you call this function, you become a client of the folder browser object. That object communicates with you by sending messages to a callback function, BrowseCallbackProc. The BFFM_IUNKNOWN message contains a pointer to the folder browser's interface. To filter folder enumeration:

item.description: Use the pointer to call the folder browser's method, and request a pointer to the IFolderFilterSite interface.
Call , and pass the folder browser a pointer to your (IUnknown or IFilterFolder?) interface.
The folder browser will then query the two methods of the IFolderFilterSite interface to determine how to filter the enumeration.
